title: How did Hurricane Katrina change New Orleans? - Quora

response.answer_text: The spirit of what makes New Orleans what is is hasn’t changed. Simply stated, Katrina righted a lot of wrongs but also wronged a lot of rights. From purely a ‘state of the city’ perspective it was arguably a net positive. But when you figure in all the pain and suffering, property damage and (especially) the loss of life, it’s no contest — it was a terrible disaster that no one who went through it will ever fully recover from for as long as they live. But NOLA is still NOLA!
A few pictures of pre and post, a couple of just post-Katrina New Orleans. Six Flags Amusement Park after Katrina           This is just a glimpse of how Katrina has changed New Orleans
